decision_conditions: The proposed development by reason of its excessive bulk, mass and height on a dwelling in a clear row of dormer bungalows would appear as a dominant and visually intrusive feature detrimental to the character and appearance of the host dwelling, the visual amenity of the surrounding area and would unbalance the pair of semi-detached dwellings contrary to Havering Local Plan Policy 7 and Policy 26 and the design guidance within the Council's Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD.

The proposed rear projection by reason of its glazing on the side elevations would lead to an unacceptable loss of amenity to adjoining neighbours due to an overbearing impact and loss of privacy, contrary to Havering Local Plan Policy 7 and the guidance within the Council's Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, it was necessary to issue a decision as close to the statutory timeframe as possible as opposed to seeking amendments which would have significantly delayed the application.
description: Roof extension and modernise ground floor
